intro: Lotononis listii, commonly known as the Kauai lotononis, is a rare flowering plant endemic to the island of Kauai in Hawaii. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers with yellow petals and a central disk. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks and in forest understories. Its conservation status is critically endangered due to habitat loss and invasive species. Efforts are underway to protect and propagate this unique species to ensure its survival.
